p: Linalool, methyl chavicol, eucalyptol, and eugenol were extracted from 50 mg of dry herb tissue with 600 μL of TBME (tetra butyl methyl ether) containing isobutylbenzene as internal standard (1.3 μg/μL). The extract was prepared by continuous shaking for 3 h, removed and washed with 500 μL of 0.1M (NH 4) 2CO 3, pH 8.0. After centrifuging for 5 min at 17,000 g, the organic upper phase was passed through a Pasteur pipette, filled with 50 mg of anhydrous Na 2SO 4 and 50 mg of silica held in place with a plug of glass wool.
